entry.title: Chinese Landscape Painting
entry.content: At the time of the Tang Era, landscape painting became the popular genre of Chinese art. The literati viewed landscape paintings as wordless poems, and poems as formless paintings,such metaphors reflect the close relationship between painting and poetry in Chinese art. Unlike the Christian paintings, the landscape paintings prefer to evoke the emotion rather than provide a objective description of reality. And landscape paintings are more secular less relative to religion. The specific nature of Chinese landscape painting is that human occupations seem mundane and incidental. So what display in front of your eyes are mountains, mist, rivers, waterfalls, flying birds, and a variety of trees in landscape paintings.
entry.summary: At the time of the Tang Era, landscape painting became the popular genre of Chinese art. The literati viewed landscape paintings as wordl

entry.title: Plague and Protest
entry.content:
As the contagious COVID-19 sweeping the world, some social riots occur in some counties with some fuels. For example, stimulated by Black Live Matter movement and disobeying in “social distancing” order, many cities occur riots in American. Let us ask an question that what is the relationship between plague and protest? To answer this question we should go back to the history the Black Death and riots in Europe.

Dated back to 1348 the deadly Black Death had swept England, and continuing for more than 300 years. During the time of epidemic, the social responses are familiar with what we are experiencing today. In other words, plague and protest are correlated.
entry.summary: As the contagious COVID-19 sweeping the world, some social riots occur in some counties with some fuels. For example, stimulated by Black

entry.title: Indian Religious Literature
entry.content:
The Mahabharata and the Ramayana, the India’s two great epics, are recorded in Sanskrit, which is the language of Indian educated classes. The Puranas, the most popular forms of Hindu literature, preserve the myths and legends of the Hindu gods. That transmitted orally for centuries, written down after 500 C.E.

We will find the difference between medieval Christian and Hinduism when seeing their values respectively. The former criticizes erotic sensuality, the latter regards the physical union of male and female as a symbolic if the eternal mingling of flesh and spirit, which would lead believers out of reincarnation.
entry.summary: The Mahabharata and the Ramayana, the India’s two great epics, are recorded in Sanskrit, which is the language of India

entry.title: Beige Gold
entry.content: Today I read an article of BBC about cardboard-stealing. The article says, there is a phenomenon in Europe that many thieves are stealing cardboard which is going to be pulped and recycled. After they steal it and export to other counties. They call cardboard “beige gold”, which means a big fortune. What surprised me that as for the pandemic, there is a rise in online shopping, so that a rise of cardboard, and then a rise of the price of recycled cardboard.
entry.summary: Today I read an article of BBC about cardboard-stealing. The article says, there is a phenomenon in Europe that many thieves are stealing

entry.title: What We Have Right Now Is Economic Failure And Inequality
entry.content:
The pandemic not only makes the poor in American getting worse, but takes a more split in American society. In fact, the pandemic did not produce inequality in society, but make it clear to people. Indeed, US billionaires’ wealth have soared since pandemic, in the contrary, the poor campaign for a rise in the national minimum wage. The connotation is that inequality is a pre-existing condition in US.

When we talk about American dream, we mean that is the ability to pull yourself up by your bootstraps. But in the real world, the tension makes it harder to from rags to riches. For the low income bracket, deadlocked by attendant recession after pandemic.

Making billions v making ends meet: how the pandemic has split the US economy in two
entry.summary: The pandemic not only makes the poor in American getting worse, but takes a more split in American society. In fact, the pandemic did no

entry.title: Protest in Eastern Europe
entry.content:
Young Belarussians risk their life and limb for the idea of a free election, protest to Lukashenko, who is called “last dictator of Europe”, president of Belarus. But the young are not the only one to protest. Factory workers also want to a fair election. As for that, soldiers and polices do not want to brutalizing their citizens and then they resign.

Today we see that people in Russia and Egypt agitating for democracy. American aim to give them award for their “bravery”. The connotation is that their people to over take their government. Authoritarianism still existing in our life. From protest in Belarus we see the rage of people have been lighted.
entry.summary: Young Belarussians risk their life and limb for the idea of a free election, protest to Lukashenko, who is called “last dictator of Euro

entry.title: Today and History
entry.content:
Today is 12th anniversary of Beijing Olympic. Dated back to the night of 08/08/2008, I was came back from Haikou to Dongfang, with my grandparents. That is a clear memory in my life. Not for a grand time in China, but for a time for me accompanied by my grandparents.

Today, I start to read a new book, The Rule of Law, written by Tom Bingham, who is a former judge of Britain. It is light me that at the beginning of this book, Tom Bingham displayed many explanations about the expression “the rule of law” of different scholars and judges. He did not laid down his idea about the expression.

The expression ‘the rule of law’ first appearance in An Introduction to the Study of the Law of the Constitution, by A. V. Dicey, a professor of English law at the Oxford. There are three meanings of the rule of law defined by Dicey:

We mean, in the first place, that no man is punishable or can lawfully be made to suffer in body or goods except for a distinct breach of law established in the ordinary legal manner before the ordinary courts of the land.

We mean in the second place, when we speak of “the rule of law” as a characteristic of our country, not only that with us no man is above the law, but (which is a different thing) that here, every man, whatever be his rank or condition, is subject to the ordinary tribunals.

There remains yet a third and a different sense in which “the rule of law” or the predominance of the legal spirit may be described as a special attribute of English institutions. We may say that the constitution is pervaded by the rule of law on the ground that the general principles of the constitution (as for example the right to personal liberty, or the right of public meeting) are with us the result of judicial decisions determining the right of private persons in particular cases brought before the courts; whereas under many foreign constitutions the security (such as it is) given to the rights of individuals results, or appears to result, from the general principles of the constitution.
entry.summary: Today is 12th anniversary of Beijing Olympic. Dated back to the night of 08/08/2008, I was came back from Haikou to Dongfang, with my grandparents. That is a clear memory in my life. Not for a grand time in China, but for a time for me accompanied by my grandparents.
